The number of COVID: 19 cases reported among meatpacking workers compared to health care workers: The expert's verdict states that there have been significantly more cases reported among health care employees than meatpacking workers. This aspect verifies the inaccuracy of the claim that 5,000 meatpackers tested positive while not the same number of nurses and doctors did.
The impact of COVID: 19 on the food supply chain: The expert's verdict mentions the disruption caused by COVID-19 among food processing workers, leading to the closure of meatpacking plants and reductions in pork and beef slaughter capacity. It also mentions President Trump's executive order to reopen meatpacking facilities to maintain the food supply chain. This aspect highlights the broader impact of COVID-19 on the food industry and the measures taken to address it.
